name: Velocity
short_description: Serve HTML content using Apache's Velocity template engine

documentation.description: Ktor includes support for `Velocity` templates through the Velocity plugin. Initialize the `Velocity` plugin with the `VelocityEngine`
documentation.usage:
You can install Velocity, and configure the VelocityEngine.

```kotlin
install(Velocity) {
    setProperty("resource.loader", "classpath")
    setProperty("classpath.resource.loader.class", ClasspathResourceLoader::class.java.name)
}
```
When Velocity is configured, you can call the call.respond method with a VelocityContent instance:

```kotlin
data class User(val name: String, val email: String)

get("/") {
	 val user = User("user name", "user@example.com")
    call.respond(VelocityContent("templates/hello.vl", user))
}
```
documentation.options: * `setProperty` -- sets string property for a Velocity engine

templates.text: data class VelocityUser(val id: Int, val name: String)
